content:
Hi all,

I realise this is a bit of a contentious request, but the rustup repo has been being spammed by https://github.com/J-Vin on and off for a while now. Often commenting on, or "approving" in-progress PRs or things which are otherwise blocked and not doing anything useful. (Example here: https://github.com/rust-lang/rustup/pull/2433#pullrequestreview-591083162 )

I'm not sure I can ban them from the rustup repo, but it's getting to the point that I think they possibly ought to be banned from the whole of /rust-lang/ on github. No amount of complaining to github has resulted in the user behaving themselves.

If there's a better approach than a ban-hammer I'd be happy to try it.

D.
@Daniel Silverstone I'm confused, random external people are allowed to approve of PRs?

It's best if you write a message to mods@rust-lang.org with precisely what you said and they will guide you from there. This seems like a rather quick case, but all such action should go through mods, even to just make sure that they are aware of those patterns.

Anyone can hit approve afaict :frown:
And thanks for the hint of mods@ I shall email them for guidance.
@Daniel Silverstone IMO you should gain the ability to perform that level of moderation on that repo, but I'm not sure if there's a technical limitation preventing that or not. :shrug:
